title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: (a) These Regulations may be cited as the Solicitors Acts 1954 to
text_raw:
1. 

(a) These Regulations may be cited as the Solicitors Acts 1954 to 
2015 (Regulation of Practice Committee) Regulations 2020. 
(b) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 1st day of 

September 2020.
text_norm: 1 (a) regulation may cited solicitor act 1954 2015 (regulation practice committee) regulation 2020 (b) regulation shall come operation 1st day september 2020

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: In these Regulations -
text_raw:
2. 

(a) 

In these Regulations - 

“Act of 1994” means the Solicitors (Amendment) Act 1994 (No. 27 of 
1994), as amended from time to time; 

“Acts” means the Solicitors Acts 1954 to 2015; 

“Council” means the Council of the Society; 

“Committee” means the committee of the Council of the Society to 
which, inter alia, various powers and functions have been delegated by 
the Council in relation to the Solicitors Accounts Regulations; 

“Authorised Person” means a person appointed pursuant to Section 14 
of the Act of 1994, as amended by Section 15 of the Solicitors 
(Amendment) Act 2002, and Section 197 of the Legal Services 
Regulation Act 2015, or an authorised person for the purposes of 
Section 66(10) of the Solicitors Act 1954, as substituted by Section 76 
of the Act of 1994, and the Solicitors Accounts Regulations, and for the 
purposes of exercising any of the Society's functions under Section 63 
of the Criminal Justice (Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing) 
Act 2010; 

“Society” means the Law Society of Ireland; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 7th July, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [239] 3 

“Solicitors Accounts Regulations” has the same meaning as in the 
Legal Services Regulation Act 2015. 

(b) Other words and phrases in these Regulations shall have the 

meaning assigned to them in the Acts. 

(c) 

In these Regulations, unless the context otherwise requires, the 
singular includes the plural.
text_norm: 2 (a) regulation - act 1994 mean solicitor (amendment) act 1994 (no 27 1994) amended time time act mean solicitor act 1954 2015 council mean council society committee mean committee council society inter alia various power function delegated council relation solicitor account regulation authorised person mean person appointed pursuant section 14 act 1994 amended section 15 solicitor (amendment) act 2002 section 197 legal service regulation act 2015 authorised person purpose section 66(10) solicitor act 1954 substituted section 76 act 1994 solicitor account regulation purpose exercising society function section 63 criminal justice (money laundering terrorist financing) act 2010 society mean law society ireland notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 7th july 2020 239 3 solicitor account regulation meaning legal service regulation act 2015 (b) word phrase regulation shall meaning assigned act (c) regulation unless context otherwise requires singular includes plural

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 3. These Regulations shall apply where the Committee is investigating
text_raw:
3. These Regulations shall apply where the Committee is investigating 
conduct on the part of a solicitor and requires the attendance of the solicitor at 
a meeting of the Committee.
text_norm: 3 regulation shall apply committee investigating conduct part solicitor requires attendance solicitor meeting committee

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 4. These Regulations shall be applied so as to be in conformity with the
text_raw:
4. These Regulations shall be applied so as to be in conformity with the 
Acts and in the event of there being an apparent conflict between these 
Regulations and any provision or provisions of the Acts these Regulations shall 
be construed so as to be in conformity with the provision or provisions of the 
Acts.
text_norm: 4 regulation shall applied conformity act event apparent conflict regulation provision provision act regulation shall construed conformity provision provision act

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 5. These Regulations shall be construed so as to be in conformity with any
text_raw:
5. These Regulations shall be construed so as to be in conformity with any 
delegation of power as may be made from time to time in accordance with the 
Acts and any Regulations made thereunder and, in particular, by the Council to 
the Committee and by the Committee to senior officers of the Society.
text_norm: 5 regulation shall construed conformity delegation power may made time time accordance act regulation made thereunder particular council committee committee senior officer society

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 6. These Regulations are made without prejudice generally to the
text_raw:
6. These Regulations are made without prejudice generally to the 

provisions of the Acts.
text_norm: 6 regulation made without prejudice generally provision act

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 7. The Society has the power to investigate alleged misconduct whether or
text_raw:
7. The Society has the power to investigate alleged misconduct whether or 

not the Society receives a complaint in relation to the solicitor.
text_norm: 7 society power investigate alleged misconduct whether society receives complaint relation solicitor

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 8. Prior to a meeting of the Committee to which these Regulations apply,
text_raw:
8. Prior to a meeting of the Committee to which these Regulations apply, 

the Society shall notify the solicitor of: 

(a) 

(b) 

the date and time of any meeting of the Committee at which the 
matter will be considered, the purpose of the meeting, the 
matters to be considered at the meeting, and the steps which 
may be taken by the Committee; 

the fact that any failure by the solicitor to attend a meeting of the 
Committee when required to do so, without reasonable cause, 
may amount to a conduct issue.
text_norm: 8 prior meeting committee regulation apply society shall notify solicitor (a) (b) date time meeting committee matter considered purpose meeting matter considered meeting step may taken committee fact failure solicitor attend meeting committee required without reasonable cause may amount conduct issue

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 9. A solicitor shall provide a written response to any conduct matter for
text_raw:
9. A solicitor shall provide a written response to any conduct matter for 
consideration by the Committee, when required to do so, on or before such date 
in advance of the meeting as may be specified by the Society.
text_norm: 9 solicitor shall provide written response conduct matter consideration committee required date advance meeting may specified society

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 10. Where a solicitor requests an adjournment of the Committee’s
text_raw:
10. Where a solicitor requests an adjournment of the Committee’s 

consideration of the matter: 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [239] 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

in all cases, the solicitor shall give reasonable notice in writing 
to the Society showing good and sufficient reason; 
in all cases where there are sufficient medical grounds the 
request should be accompanied by medical evidence and the 
request may be refused in the absence of such medical evidence; 
an adjournment request may be approved in advance of a 
meeting of the Committee by the Society.
text_norm: 10 solicitor request adjournment committee consideration matter 4 239 (a) (b) (c) case solicitor shall give reasonable notice writing society showing good sufficient reason case sufficient medical ground request accompanied medical evidence request may refused absence medical evidence adjournment request may approved advance meeting committee society

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 11. Notwithstanding Regulations 3 and 9, if a solicitor does not, without
text_raw:
11. Notwithstanding Regulations 3 and 9, if a solicitor does not, without 

reasonable explanation: 

(a) 

(b) 

appear before the Committee when required to do so; and/or 

provide a written response to any conduct matter within the time 
specified by the Society; 

and in the absence of an adjournment having been granted, the 
Committee may deal with the matter in his/her absence on the basis of 
the documents already furnished and information available to the 
Society and in accordance with these Regulations, the Acts, the 
Solicitors Accounts Regulations and any other relevant legislation.
text_norm: 11 notwithstanding regulation 3 9 solicitor without reasonable explanation (a) (b) appear committee required provide written response conduct matter within time specified society absence adjournment granted committee may deal matter absence basis document already furnished information available society accordance regulation act solicitor account regulation relevant legislation

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 12. The Committee may seek legal opinion in relation to the investigation
text_raw:
12. The Committee may seek legal opinion in relation to the investigation 
of a particular matter. Where it does so, it shall disclose such opinion to the 
solicitor and afford the solicitor an opportunity to make submissions in 
response to such opinion before making a decision on any matter in respect of 
which the opinion has been obtained.
text_norm: 12 committee may seek legal opinion relation investigation particular matter shall disclose opinion solicitor afford solicitor opportunity make submission response opinion making decision matter respect opinion obtained

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 13. The Committee may seek independent expert report(s) to assist it.
text_raw:
13. The Committee may seek independent expert report(s) to assist it. 
Where it does so it shall disclose such report(s) to the solicitor and afford the 
solicitor an opportunity to make submissions in respect of such report(s), to 
include the opportunity to submit expert report(s) in response.
text_norm: 13 committee may seek independent expert report(s) assist it shall disclose report(s) solicitor afford solicitor opportunity make submission respect report(s) include opportunity submit expert report(s) response

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 14. At each Committee meeting:
text_raw:
14. At each Committee meeting: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

the Committee shall, where possible and in a manner consistent 
with fair procedures, act in an informal and expeditious manner; 
subject to any express provision in these Regulations, the 
Committee may regulate its procedure; 
a solicitor who is required to attend before the Committee may 
attend any such meeting personally or by legal representation or 
both (unless expressly required by the Committee to attend in 
person when the solicitor shall attend in person with or without 
legal representation) and shall be permitted to make oral and/or 
written submissions; 
the meeting shall take place in private and no audio or visual 
recordings of the meeting shall be permitted, save that a record 
of the meeting (excluding any deliberations of the Committee) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [239] 5 

may at the request of the solicitor and with the consent of the 
Committee, be taken by a stenographer, subject to a right of the 
Committee to be provided with a copy of the transcript, free of 
charge and at the same time as when it is delivered to the 
solicitor; 
the Committee shall arrange for a minute to be taken (excluding 
any deliberations of the Committee); 

(e) 

(f) where an Authorised Person has been appointed, the Authorised 
Person, or, where the Authorised Person is unavailable, another 
person nominated by the Society: 
i. 

shall be in attendance at a meeting for the purpose of 
assisting the Committee and the solicitor concerned with 
any aspects of their report which require clarification and 
explanation, 
shall deal with any questions raised by the Committee or 
the solicitor concerned on any issue arising from their 
report, 

ii. 

iii. may only attend the meeting: 

a) 

 in the presence of the solicitor, where the solicitor 
has attended the meeting, or 

b) where the solicitor has not attended the meeting, for 
that portion of the meeting in respect of which the 
solicitor would have been present, had they attended. 

(g) 

if, in the course of its deliberations, the Committee considers 
that an issue has arisen which requires further clarification, 
response or submission from the solicitor and/or the Authorised 
Person, the solicitor and/or the Authorised Person shall be 
invited to return to the meeting for further interview and/or 
response.

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 15. The Committee shall satisfy itself before making a decision:
text_raw:
15. The Committee shall satisfy itself before making a decision: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

that, where relevant, the solicitor has been notified, prior to any 
meeting, that the matter is being investigated as a matter of 
alleged misconduct; 
that the solicitor has had an opportunity to consider all relevant 
documentation furnished to the Committee; 
that the solicitor has had an opportunity, where relevant, to 
comment on 
the 
Committee: 
(i) 

the appropriateness, or otherwise, of 

issuing a direction pursuant to Section14A(3)(a) of the Act 
of 1994; or 
issuing a notice pursuant to Section14A(7)(a) of the Act of 
1994; or 

(ii) 

(iii) making an application for the holding of an inquiry to the 
Legal Practitioners Disciplinary Tribunal pursuant to 
Section 14A(6) of the Act or 1994; or 

 
 
 
 
 6 [239] 

(iv) 

(v) 

taking such other steps or actions as may be available to it 
pursuant to the Acts, the Solicitors Accounts Regulations 
or otherwise; or 
taking no further action.
text_norm: 15 committee shall satisfy making decision (a) (b) (c) relevant solicitor notified prior meeting matter investigated matter alleged misconduct solicitor opportunity consider relevant documentation furnished committee solicitor opportunity relevant comment committee (i) appropriateness otherwise issuing direction pursuant section14a(3)(a) act 1994 issuing notice pursuant section14a(7)(a) act 1994 (ii) (iii) making application holding inquiry legal practitioner disciplinary tribunal pursuant section 14a(6) act 1994 6 239 (iv) (v) taking step action may available pursuant act solicitor account regulation otherwise taking action

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 16. The Committee shall give reasons for its decisions.
text_raw: 16. The Committee shall give reasons for its decisions.

title: MAKES the following Regulations regulating procedure in relation to matters
heading: 17. In accordance with its powers under the Acts, and without prejudice to
text_raw:
17. In accordance with its powers under the Acts, and without prejudice to 
the full extent of those powers, the Committee may, subject to these 
Regulations, exercise all of the powers under the Acts, the Solicitors Accounts 
Regulations or otherwise, that have been delegated to it by the Council of the 
Society. 

Signed on behalf of the Law Society of Ireland pursuant to section 79 of the 
Solicitors Act 1954. 

Dated this 15 day of June 2020 

MICHELE O'BOYLE, 

President of the Law Society of Ireland. 

The Legal Services Regulatory Authority concur, pursuant to subsection (1) of 
Section 66 (as substituted by Section 76 of the Solicitors (Amendment) Act 
1994) of the Solicitors Act 1954, as amended by Section 182 of the Legal 
Services Regulation Act 2015, to the making of the within Regulations. 

Dated this 29 day of June 2020 

On behalf of the Legal Services Regulatory Authority 

BRIAN DOHERTY, 

Chief Executive Officer.
